class.name: Shifter
proficiency: and your choice of Dexterity or Constitution

default: (a) a {@item shortbow|Ishiir} and a {@item quiver|phb} of 20 arrows or (b) any {@filter simple weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=simple weapon}
(a) a {@item club|Ishiir} or (b) any {@filter simple weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=simple weapon}
An {@item explorer's pack|phb}, and four {@item dagger|Ishiir|daggers}

classFeature.name: Formshift
entries: By choice or circumstance, you possess the ability to shift into an animal-like form that outfits you with heightened senses, swiftness, and primal ferocity in battle. You shift forms as a bonus action. While shifted, you gain the following benefits as long as you aren't wearing armor heavier than light or a shield:

items: You have advantage on {@skill Perception} checks.
When you make a melee weapon attack with your natural weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to the damage roll. This bonus increases as you level.

entries: If you are able to cast spells, you can't cast them or concentrate on them while shifted.

Your Formshift lasts for an amount of hours equal to your shifter level. It ends early if you fall {@condition Unconscious|Ishiir} or you are {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir}. You can also end your Formshift as a bonus action.

You can Formshift a number of times shown for your Shifter level in the Formshifts column of the Shifter Features table. You regain one expended use when you finish a Short Rest, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

You choose whether your equipment falls to the ground in your space, merges into your shifted form, or is worn by it. Worn equipment functions as normal, but the DM decides whether it is practical for your shifted form to wear a piece of equipment, based on your shape and size. Your equipment doesn't change size or shape to match the new form, and any equipment that your shifted form can't wear must either fall to the ground or merge with it. Equipment that merges with your shifted form has no effect until you leave Formshift.

classFeature.name: Natural Weapons
entries: Even when not shifted, your form is permanently altered to include fangs, claws, or talons. When you make a melee weapon attack with these natural weapons, you roll a {@dice d6} and add your Strength or Dexterity modifier to the attack and damage roll (your choice).
This die changes as you gain shifter levels, as shown in the Natural Weapons column of the Shifter table.

classFeature.name: Primal Defence
entries: Your animal-like swiftness or thick skin makes it more difficult to land a hit on you.
While you are wearing no armor and not wielding a shield, your AC equals 10 + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice when you get this feature) and your Constitution modifier.

classFeature.name: Fast Movement
entries: Your speed increases by 10 feet while you aren't wearing any armor or wielding a shield.

classFeature.name: Animal Senses
entries: You gain proficiency in two of the following skills: {@skill Animal Handling}, {@skill Nature}, {@skill Perception}, {@skill Stealth}, {@skill Survival}.
Additionally, you add your Formshift Damage to the chosen skills and to your initiative rolls.

classFeature.name: Wild Aspect
entries: You choose the shape of your formshift. Your choice grants you features at 3rd, 7th, 13th, and 18th levels.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Martial Mastery
entries: You gain the mastery benefits for two {@filter weapons|items|source=ishiir|type=|category=|homebrew mastery=!none;!light;!medium;!heavy} of your choice as well as an {@filter armor|items|source=ishiir|type=|category=|homebrew mastery=!none;light;medium;heavy} type (see {@variantrule Armor Mastery|Ishiir} and {@variantrule Weapon Mastery|Ishiir} variant rules). You must be proficient in the chosen weapons and armor. If you possess the Unarmored Defense feature, you may {@optfeature Unarmored Defense|Ishiir|choose it} in place of an armor type.
You can change your choices when you finish a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack|Ishiir} action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Primal Pounce
entries: Once per turn, as part of an attack with your natural weapons, you can move up to your speed in a straight line towards a target of your choice.

classFeature.name: Primal Strikes
entries: Your natural weapons count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

classFeature.name: Improved Animal Senses
entries: You cannot be {@quickref Surprise|PHB|3|0|surprised} unless you are {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir}.

classFeature.name: Wild Aspect Feature
entries: You gain one feature granted by your Wild Aspect.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Ferocious Strikes
entries: You add your Formshift Damage to your weapon damage rolls even when not currently shifted. If you are shifted, this damage bonus is doubled.

classFeature.name: Feral Resilience
entries: You add your Formshift Damage to all saving throws. You do not gain this bonus if you're unconscious.

classFeature.name: Greater Formshift
entries: You can increase your size to Large when you use your Formshift class feature and your Natural Weapons die is doubled for calculating your base weapon damage while you are shifted. If you lack the room to become Large, your size doesn't change.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Wild Aspect Feature
entries: You gain one feature granted by your Wild Aspect.

classFeature.name: Ferocious Vitality
entries: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can expend a use of your Formshift to immediately regain hit points equal to twice your Shifter level. You can't use this feature again until you finish a Long Rest.

classFeature.name: Persistent Formshift
entries: You can remain shifted for an indefinite amount of time and your Formshift does not end when you are asleep naturally. You can still end your Formshift as usual.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Wild Blessing
entries: Choose two ability scores from Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution. The chosen ability scores and their maximums increase by 2.

classFeature.name: Wild Aspect Feature
entries: You gain one feature granted by your Wild Aspect.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Primal Avatar
entries: You gain the following benefits while shifted:

items: Your can increase your size to Huge and your Natural Weapons die is doubled for calculating your base weapon damage. If you lack the room to become Huge, your size doesn't change.

You can't be {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} or {@condition Frightened|Ishiir}. If you are {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} or {@condition Frightened|Ishiir} when you use Formshift, the effect is suspended for the duration of the shift.
The healing gained from your Ferocious Vitality feature is increased to 5x your Shifter level.

subclassFeature.name: Winged Aspect
entries: You adopt an avian aspect, granting you physical traits such as the piercing eyes of a bird of prey, sharp nails, and wings sprouting from your back.
You gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed. If you are not shifted, you have to end your flying movement on the ground.
Once you reach level 10 in this class, you no longer need to end your flying movement on the ground while not shifted.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Winged Aspect
entries: You gain one of the following features of your choice.

items.name: Night Flyer.
items.entry: You gain a {@sense darkvision} range of 120 feet. If you already possess {@sense darkvision}, add 120 ft to its range.

items.name: Agile Flyer.
items.entry: Your speed increases by 10 feet and you do not provoke opportunity attacks when you fly out of an enemy's reach.

items.name: Diving Raptor.
items.entry: When you use Primal Pounce, you can move up to double your speed if your target is below you. If you moved at least 20 feet in this manner, the attack adds your Natural Weapons die to the damage again once.

subclassFeature.name: Greater Winged Aspect
entries: You gain one of the following features of your choice.

items.name: Silent Flight.
items.entry: While flying, you can {@action hide|Ishiir} as a bonus action and your wings cause no sound when you move while flying. If you attack while hidden, the benefits of being hidden persist against the target of your attack until the end of your turn.

items.name: On Swift Wings.
items.entry: When you move, you can choose a creature that is within 5 ft and at least one size smaller than you and move the creature with you until the end of the current turn. The creature's movement doesn't provoke Opportunity Attacks.

items.name: Deadly Talons.
items.entry: The critical range with your natural weapons increases by 1. When you critically hit with your natural weapons, you roll your weapon damage dice two additional times and add them to the damage.

subclassFeature.name: Superior Winged Aspect
entries: You gain one of the following features of your choice.

items.name: Death from the Dark.
entries: Once per turn, when you hit a creature you are hidden from with your natural weapons, you deal additional damage equal to two rolls of your Natural Weapons die and the target has to make a Wisdom saving throw.
The DC for this is 8 + your proficiency + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice). On a failure, the target is {@condition Frightened|Ishiir} until the end of your next turn.

items.name: Evasive Flight.
entries: When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

If you succeed on the saving throw, you can use your reaction to move up to half your speed to an unoccupied space that you can see. If you are carrying an ally or otherwise moving them with you, they also automatically succeed on the saving throw and take no damage.
You don't benefit from this feature if you have the {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir} condition.

items.name: Concussive Impact.
entries: When you use Primal Pounce and hit the target, it has to make a Constitution saving throw. The DC for this is 8 + your proficiency + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice). On a failure, the target suffers an effect based on the distance you travelled as part of Primal Pounce.

items.name: 20 feet or more:
items.entry: The target is knocked {@condition Prone|Ishiir}.

items.name: 40 feet or more:
items.entry: The target is {@condition Dazed|Ishiir} until the end of your next turn.

items.name: 60 feet or more:
items.entry: The target is {@condition Stunned|Ishiir} until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Clawed Aspect
entries: You adopt a feline aspect, granting you physical traits such as the vertical pupils, sharp nails, and elongated canines.
You gain a {@sense darkvision} range of 60 feet. If you already possess {@sense darkvision}, add 60 ft to its range.

Additionally, once per turn when you hit a creature with your natural weapons, you can force the target to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target is {@condition Lacerated|Ishiir}. The DC for this is 8 + your proficiency + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice). The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Creatures who cannot bleed are immune to this feature.
Once you reach level 10 in this class, any {@condition Lacerated|Ishiir|laceration} inflicted with your natural weapons deals damage equal to thrice your proficiency, rather than twice.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Clawed Aspect
entries: You gain one of the following features of your choice.

items.name: Stalker's Ambush.
items.entry: Any attack with your natural weapons against a creature that is surprised has advantage and adds an additional roll of your Natural Weapons die to the damage.

items.name: Swift Climber.
items.entry: You gain a climb speed equal to your walking speed and when you take fall damage, you can use your reaction to decrease that damage by an amount equal to five times your Shifter level.

items.name: Feral Pounce.
items.entry: When you use Primal Pounce and your attack hits, you can force the target to make a Strength saving throw if it is no more than one size larger than you. The DC for this is 8 + your proficiency + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice). On a failure, the target is knocked {@condition Prone|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Greater Clawed Aspect
entries: You gain one of the following features of your choice.

items.name: Stalker's Rake.
items.entry: You can {@action Hide|Ishiir} as a bonus action. If you hit a creature with your natural weapons while hidden, it has disadvantage on the next saving throw against your Clawed Aspect. Additionally, creatures {@condition Lacerated|Ishiir} by you cannot make opportunity attacks.

items.name: Big Game Hunter.
items.entry: When you use Primal Pounce and your attack hits, you can also attempt to {@action Climb onto a Bigger Creature|Ishiir} as per the Additional Combat Actions as a bonus action.

items.name: Disembowel.
items.entry: If you hit a {@condition Prone|Ishiir} creature with your natural weapons, you can force it to make the saving throw against your Clawed Aspect again, ignoring the usual per-turn limit. Once per turn, if the {@condition Prone|Ishiir} creature is already {@condition Lacerated|Ishiir}, it takes the damage from the condition immediately after the attack if it fails the saving throw.

subclassFeature.name: Superior Clawed Aspect
entries: You gain one of the following features of your choice.

items.name: Spirit Claw.
items.entry: When you are {@action Hide|Ishiir|hidden}, you ignore immunity to the {@condition Lacerated|Ishiir} condition and healing does not remove the {@condition Lacerated|Ishiir} condition if it was applied by you unless the target was healed back to its hitpoint maximum. Additionally, you have advantage on attack rolls against creatures that are {@condition Lacerated|Ishiir}.

items.name: Feline Grace.
items.entry: No attack roll has advantage against you and you cannot have disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws and ability checks. You lose these benefits when you are {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir} or your speed is 0.

items.name: Killing Bite.
items.entry: If you hit a {@condition Prone|Ishiir} creature with your natural weapons, you can immediately make another attack with them as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Fanged Aspect
entries: You adopt a canine aspect, granting you physical traits such as the piercing eyes, sharp nails, and elongated canines.
You gain a {@sense darkvision} range of 60 feet. If you already possess {@sense darkvision}, add 60 ft to its range.

Once per turn when you hit a creature with your natural weapons, you can force the target to make a Strength saving throw. On a failure, the target is knocked {@condition Prone|Ishiir}. The DC for this is 8 + your proficiency + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice). If the target creature is already {@condition Prone|Ishiir}, you can attempt to {@condition Grappled|Ishiir|grapple} it instead, using the usual skill check instead of forcing a saving throw.
Once you reach level 10 in this class, you count as 1 size larger for the purposes of this feature.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Fanged Aspect
entries: You gain one of the following features of your choice.

items.name: Pack Tactics.
items.entry: You have advantage on attack rolls with your natural weapons against a creature if at least one of your allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir}.

items.name: A Friend in Deed.
items.entry: You can take the {@action Help|Ishiir} action as a bonus action and with a range of 30 feet. You can always use the {@action Help|Ishiir} action to give someone advantage on a skill check, even if you are not proficient in the relevant skill yourself.

items.name: Thick Hide.
items.entry: The temporary hit points gained through your Martial Mastery (Unarmored Defense) increase by half (rounded down). Additionally, you have advantage on saving throws against becoming {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir} or {@condition Lacerated|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Greater Fanged Aspect
entries: You gain one of the following features of your choice.

items.name: Coordinated Takedown.
items.entry: When a creature within reach of your natural weapons is hit by a melee attack from one of your allies, you can use your reaction to immediately force that creature to make a Strength saving throw as per your Fanged Aspect feature.

items.name: Bolstering Barks.
items.entry: Whenever you use the {@action Help|Ishiir} action on one of your allies, they gain temporary hit points equal to half your Shifter level.

items.name: Fierce Protector.
items.entry: When you hit a creature with your natural weapons, it has disadvantage on attack rolls against creatures other than you until the end of your next turn while it is within your reach. If it makes an attack against a target other than you during that time, you have advantage on your next attack roll against it and add half your Shifter level to the damage roll (rounded down).

subclassFeature.name: Superior Fanged Aspect
entries: You gain one of the following features of your choice.

items.name: Killing Bite.
items.entry: If you hit a {@condition Prone|Ishiir} creature with your natural weapons, you can immediately make another attack with them as a bonus action.

items.name: Stronger Together.
items.entry: Allies within 20 feet of you also benefit from your Feral Resilience while you are not {@condition Unconscious|Ishiir}.

items.name: Feral Defiance.
items.entry: Your Ferocious Vitality recharges on a Short or Long Rest and heals for 1x Shifter level additional hit points.
